website_summaries.verdict: An excellent shoe that keeps feet comfortable while preventing slipping.
pros: Gel system makes them comfortable no matter the terrain
cons: Firm sole is too stiff for some

customer_reviews.title: Great trail runners
customer_reviews.text: Another great pair. I've been wearing Asics for years and like the fit for my flat feet. Roomy toe box and well-fitting heels means zero blisters for me. These Gel-Kahanas have rugged tread for navigating rocky trails and uneven roads. The long stabilizer in the sole gives me the support needed to power up and down hills without making my (lack of) arches hurt. Love the color combos, I want them all!
customer_reviews.author: NurseBent

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is right around my 8th pair of Gel Kahana's. I love these shoes. I wear them every day and they last and look great for at least a year. I buy one pair every year - the old ones get to be my gardening shoes and I wear them another year or more. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: BETSY

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and amazing fit!
customer_reviews.text: Love these ASICS! Especially the bottoms because they grip better while walking through the snow. I would definitely purchase these again! Also I like the fact I can take the insoles out and put my orthotics in these shoes. I stand in a pharmacy approx 8-9 hours a day. Walk miles and miles, I get a new pair of ASICS every 6 months or so! They always hold up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Overcomer16

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fussy feet!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! So much cushion between me and the trail or road, and they fit like a glove. I have high arches, and am prone to plantar fasciitis, and these shoes are perfect to keep my feet in good, working order. Also, they have a great, grippy sole that is perfect for dirt and gravel trails, and also fine indoors. I am about to order another pair to have as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn T

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shoes with excellent support for trail walking!
customer_reviews.text: After wearing these a few days, I am happy with my purchase. I ordered a 9 instead of 8 1/2 as many commented that these shoes ran small. I sometimes have to use orthotics so needed room for them. The arch support and construction of the shoe is excellent, so no need for orthotics for me. I do not feel stones or roots during trail walks. They are roomy enough for a heavy sock and have plenty of room in the toe box . I have a narrow hee,l but am able to tighten the laces to avoid heel slippage. I love these shoes and highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As others have said - quite narrow
customer_reviews.text: Does appear to be very well-made, nice treads on the bottom for trail running, and I like the materials. Was very excited until I tried them on. Problem is, the complaints of it being a narrow made shoe are accurate. Usually when reviews say that the shoes are too narrow, I order them and they fit great. I always buy my running shoes larger than my regular shoes. I did that with this style, but even ordering one size larger, they were so narrow in the forefoot that even when I completely unlaced them, they were still uncomfortable. Put them right back in the box and started a return. Disappointed. Still trying to find a nice stability trail runner.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Feet!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes seem to run small...so I ordered 1/2 size up...perfect for me. I like this shoe because it is a little wider than some others and gives my toes plenty of room. The sole seems to have a good "grip" and will give firm footing. The colors are nice as well. I plan to wear these on an upcoming trip: expect lots of walking around town and on easy trails.
customer_reviews.author: TexasWyatt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Whatever happened to Asics? Their shoes have gotten so ugly and poor quality overnight, it seems like. At least since my last pair, a couple of years ago. I have gone through a few pairs on Amazon now, and I can't seem to find anything in the same category of quality as my old pair. The new ones look cheap and shapeless. My old pair is worn out, and I stick with it, because I don't even know where to go for a new brand, I was so used to going to Asics. Good product gone bad, always disappointing to see.
customer_reviews.author: DesertReal

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe for moderate workout
customer_reviews.text: Until recently, I've been a diehard fan of the Asics running shoe, Asics Gel Kayano, but my long-distance running days are over. So I downgraded to this model, and I have been very happy with their comfort, (light) weight, flexibility, stability, and durability. For the running and other exercise I do, these are excellent. I add Spenko pads to give added cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Better than the GT-2000
customer_reviews.text: I always buy Asics after I was fitted at a sporting goods store and they told me that's what I needed. They recommended the GT-2000, which I've worn religiously for 10+ years. It really helped my bad hip due to overpronation. I really haven't like the color selection on the GT-2000, so researched for another Asic shoe that would help my hip. This one has been just as good for my hip as the GT-2000. One noticeable difference was the room in the toe area. The Gel-Kahana 8 are much roomier in that area. I really like the fit and will most likely make this my go to shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love them, but defect within six days.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes. Unfortunately, I've had them for a total of six days and the sole is already peeling away from the bottom of the shoe. Pretty bummed about this. I'm going to contact Asics as well to let them know. I wonder if it's a manufacturer defect. I'd order again only to hope they don't fall apart......
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M. Witson

customer_reviews.title: ASIC shoes are extremely poor quality and only last a few months before they fall apart.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ASIC Trail Running shoes for trail Running and hiking. I purchased them in January 2019 and started hiking in them about three months ago and they are falling apart. The soles are literally falling off and the front toe cover material is starting to peel off as you can see in the pictures. I was hiking in them today and my hiking partner watched some of the sole fall off as they were hiking behind me. I would like to return them as I believe that ASIC should last not be falling apart after only a few months. I can not wear them anymore as they are so damaged.
customer_reviews.author: MASON

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my Plantar Fasciitis, they HELP!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my relatively new condition plantars fasciitis, they make a big difference. There is still pain but it's far less with these. The hills of San Fransisco can do a number on your feet & legs. Ouch!a They do run half a size small. I'm a 9.5, got a 10 and it's perfect. Also bought some support slippers by Vionic for around the house. They also help.
customer_reviews.author: Nonya

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but slippery little suckers!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: for me, it’s always a great, consistent fit with ASICS, and this shoe didn’t disappoint. There’s something in the heel that I believe is to aid the prevention of overpronating. I don’t know how effective it’ll be, but it’s not uncomfortable. Cons: the outsole... it did NOT perform well as I walked across a tile restaurant floor. I slipped and slid across the floor as though I were on ice. At first I thought it was the floor, but I was the only one who looked like Bambi on his first day walking. I really like ASICS, but the slippery sole could be dangerous. These will be remanded to dry, outdoor terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Alley Cat

customer_reviews.title: Slippery sole.
customer_reviews.text: I love the brand but would not purchase this particular shoe again. I bought it for daily errand walking, not for running or a particular type of workout. I found the heel area to be wide so be wary if you have a narrow heel. Also, the sole of the shoe is extremely slippery on wet surfaces even though at sight, the sole looks like it would grip sucurely. For walks of a mile or longer the shoe hurts the outside of my feet, not my arch but more the outer edge of my foot. I have tried thick and thin socks with no change.
customer_reviews.author: 5Points buyer

customer_reviews.title: Very stiff
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this pair of shoes because it was made for trail running and the price was decent. I ordered half a size up like I usually do for sneakers but it was still too small. My foot is wider, so it didn't fit well width-wise and the toe box also felt small. The whole shoe just felt very stiff and hard and there was zero arch support, nor was the insole that came with it very soft/flexible. Overall, the whole shoe felt very uncomfortable and hard when just walking around the house. Too bad, the bottom does look great for trails (looks very grippy).
customer_reviews.author: GOKarasuno

customer_reviews.title: But I still love Asics! The most supportive & comfortable shoes I've ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Asics for many years. This is the first time I've ever had to size up. I'm usually a 6 to a 7 in every other shoe and in recent years I've been at 7.5 in these shoes. This is a first I've ever had to order up to a size 8. No, my feet didn't get bigger. These shoes got smaller. I measured these size 8 next to my 7.5's and they are exactly even. Weird. But I still love Asics! The most supportive & comfortable shoes I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal Princess

customer_reviews.title: Not the real deal- fake Asics
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Asics for years, but always in a store. These are fake. They hurt my feet the minute I put them on. The material is hard, whereas real Asics are more pliable hence the reason they are so great for running and molding to your feet. You get what you pay for. 59.00 does not give you authentic Asics. I will go to a brick and mortar store and pay more for the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes on July 4, they arrived July 9, 2020. I wore them off and on a few hours a day, and in just 10 days the shoe on the left no longer supported my foot, and my foot started going to the left making me walk on the outside of the shoe. I had this problem with this brand years, ago, but decided to give them another try. I am sorry they still are of poor quality. Not worth the investment. Will try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: L. Nedilsky

customer_reviews.title: Trail running tread?
customer_reviews.text: These running shoes run a little small, so I ordered a half size up and they fit just fine. I love the arch support and DuoMax support to prevent me from over pronating. Asics with the DuoMax are the only running shoe I will wear. I like the color ok. My only issue is that these seem like trail runners due to the deep treads. I like them enough to keep them, but will see how I like them for running and working out with this tread.
customer_reviews.author: INgirl

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Bit disappointed in these. I was trying to purchase some good shoes for walking a few miles at a time. So far, they are too tight width wise (and no i dont have wide feet), and they are very stiff and uncomfortable making my feet hurt more. I am hoping these will “break in” a little since i have worn them out walking a few times and cant return them now :( will keep trying for another week and update if they get any better. What a waste of money so far. That said, they do seem to be made well in al other aspects and they shipping quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Shoe! Order a 1/2 size up!
customer_reviews.text: I very, much find these shoes a dramatic improvement over my previous tennis shoe, which was a Dr. Scholl's brand. The tread is intricate and has some heft, despite the shoe being relatively quite lightweight. I ordered a 1/2 size up, after having read the reviews of other customers, and I must say, it was an accurate conclusion. I have long toes, and a large foot, and I simply did not want to burden myself with an amazing shoe in an incorrect size. I highly recommend this shoe. I ordered it over the Black Friday weekend, and it was $57.00. For the price, the shoe has made me very content.
customer_reviews.author: Blair Fawcett

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, supportive
customer_reviews.text: These shoes seem well made and have a nice, grippy sole for trail running. They also fit true to size, with my regular 9 (for running shoes - usually an 8.5 in other shoes) fitting well with a little wiggle room in the toes. They have quite a bit of support inside which is ultimately what did not work for me as the support "bumps" felt uncomfortable. For those who need more support this shoe will likely be a winner, but my feet prefer more a flatter, cushy insole. While I ended up returning them they seem like well-made shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Really like the look of the shoes
customer_reviews.text: Really like the look of the shoes. I love Asics and usually buy Cumulous, but saw these and thought I’d give them a try because of the price. They fit a little small, as expected. I wear a 7.5 or sometimes 7, but with my Asics running shoes I always go with an 8. I gave these shoes a test drive today and am still a bit undecided. They are not uncomfortable, but they are a little more stiff and not as cushioned as I had in the past. They almost seem like trail running shoes because of the deeper tread. Might need to put in a few more treadmill miles to decide.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E Arnold

customer_reviews.title: FAKE AISICS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my wife and then the disappointments started. First the delivery delays (which wasn't their fault I realize). The shoes showed over a week from expected delivery. When my wife finally got them, she was upset. Upon trying the shoes on, she discovered that they were two different sizes and uncomfortably narrower than previous Asics she had owned. Examining the shoes further, she found a label that wasn't quite right. Researching she discovered that in fact the shoes were knock offs. Overall a very disappointing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J Heiskell

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit
customer_reviews.text: The two most important things I look for in a pair of running shoes is the fit and appearance. Although my favorite brand is Adidas, I decided to try this pair since I could not find the Adidas Kanadia TR 3 size 7.0 for women with this specific style and colour. To my amazement, this fit wonderfully! The only down side is that it squeaks when I walk in them; fortunately, my gym has their speakers on full blast. We shall see the durability in time, and I will edit this review in a few months...
customer_reviews.author: Lolita M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Plantar fasciitis sufferers
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical ordering these from Amazon because I feel like you really need to try on shoes before. There’s so many things that can go wrong, fit, size, just how they are made or the level of support... These are great, I am a teacher and I walk on concrete floors all day. These really help my feet to feel better
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: High quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a very long time for a quality pair of walking/running shoes with a strong, solid sole vs the light weight "air foam" soles that are so popular now. I need more support for my foot pad and sole. These shoes are well built and my orthotics fit perfectly (removal shoe pad in shoe). The shoe is not as wide as the Saucony's I'm used to, so I sized up by 1/2 and loosened the laces in that area - works well. I've worn them a few times for long walks and so far, they feel and perform great. Excellent price as well. (Shoelaces are too short, but that's an easy fix! :)
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes and have bought many, many pairs. They are narrow enough for my heel, have a roomy toe box, great arch support, and plenty of cushioning. I've got old sports injuries and these help a lot with ankle stability, and knee and back pain. And the dark steel/pink glow/mint color is very cute. They do run a bit smaller than Asics used to, and I sized up half a size, so if you haven't bought Asics in a while, it's possible you will find your old size too tight.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Stiff shoe, also be aware that Asics sizes run EVEN smaller in the last five years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe because I couldn't resist the low price. I wear between a 6 and 6.5 in normal shoes and between 6.5 and 7 in trainers. I already knew that Asics sized down, so instead of 6.5, I ordered a 7. These in size 7 are at least a centimeter smaller than my old 6.5 Gel-Kayano 22s. I might have exchanged for a larger size, but I decided to not compromise, and I ordered the GT 2000 Trail 7s in size 7.5 (now we are at 1- 1.5 sizes above normal). I am so glad I upgraded to the GT 2000s. These Gel-Kahanas are stiff and do not have nearly the same level of comfort as the GTs.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kaput

customer_reviews.title: ASICS brand = AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit like a DREAM and exactly what I would expect from ASICS. Perfect for those of us over 50 and find that we need a good fitting shoe with the benefits of a more casual style. As others have noted, it is a firm shoe with a solid, but not quite tight, heel cup so if you are looking for something more pliable, this shoe is not for you. Will flex at the toes but not other places. Does accommodate a liner or arch support so once shoes are used for a bit that's a nice benefit.
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit, Good Support
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my wife due to a recommendation from a very experienced shoe salesman who is also a runner and who has also experienced a torn Achilles Tendon. Great advice and a very good move on our part. Having first spent a ton of money at the G**D F**T store with zero success, this was the best solution. Outstanding arch support and a fit that was spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Greystoke

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite ASICS shoe model
customer_reviews.text: I have over pronation and these had some of the best out of the box support I have found. I will replace the insoles with inserts for my feet in time, but the only thing I was surprised is overall they are a bit stiff for running, but I like that they aren't flimsy and my foot doesn't slide all over the place. I'm not a runner, so for me I wasn't sure why they are considered a running shoe. Either way, already got another pair, in a different color on order.
customer_reviews.author: CrzRani

customer_reviews.title: asics gels never disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I've been sold on Asics gels for 20 years ever since I was fitted at a Nordstrom's. I am now a retired ER nurse, but for years put on a lot of miles on hard concrete floors and even after 12 hour shifts my feet were never exhausted or in any kind of pain. I need the wider toe box and arch support. Now they are my favorite walking all purpose shoe.
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Swap the insoles, the rest is great
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfectly and have great grip to the soles. The first few times I wore them, I had soreness in the arch of my foot, so swapped out the insoles for ones with better arch support. They've gotten me up steep, muddy banks with minimal toe holds, through creeks and ankle-deep mud, over loose rocks, and regular trails. I've even used them to mow the "death hill" in my yard (the one that I usually slide down sideways while trying not to die with the mower), and they get good grip, haven't been pulled off in the mud (yet), and drain quickly. They do not dry quickly, though.
customer_reviews.author: H. Billings

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I have run in the same size ASICS for years and this pair is very differently made. I have a narrow foot but this shoe is VERY narrow. Runs small and I should have listened to my gut and sent it back immediately for a larger size but I decided it would be ok. Just 2 months later and had to buy other shoes or lose toe nails! I didn't have the issues with them being slippery that others mentioned but haven't really tested them too much in mud. Nice color and feel well constructed, just order up!
customer_reviews.author: workin'mom

customer_reviews.title: Great light trailrunner
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit and the breathability of this shoe. The laces are a little short to double tie. I've used the predecessors of this shoe for years -- and I bought it again! The tread is deep, as you want for a trailrunner, and it performs even in snow and ice. They're sturdy enough to wear on light hikes in the mountains. The fit allows me to wear my usual size rather than upsizing a half size as I do for Nike & New Balance, which is good when you're buying on line and can't try it on.
customer_reviews.author: Faye

customer_reviews.title: Ninth pair of ASICS
customer_reviews.text: I love ASICS running shoes for the mesh, support and comfort. I love that they are offered in wide width and half sizes. This is probably my ninth pair of ASICS running shoe and I have to say that this particular shoe is the WARMEST mesh shoe I have ever worn....ever, I love the support! The shoe fits snug all the way around my foot. I think the snug fit is what makes it so warm. I wear thinner socks because of it. These will make great shoes for the cooler months. Excellent traction.
customer_reviews.author: Meritt

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this is the most uncomfortable ASICS sneaker I've ever worn. I love ASICS, they are my favorite sneaker, but I bought these hoping to enjoy them while hiking, and they are hard as a rock, and have no support! I bought them long before I went hiking, so I never had a chance to return them. I should have tried them out first, but I just assumed they would be as awesome as ASICS usually are. I should have known better, we all know what happens when we assume!!! Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as the older version.
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Kahana 4 shoes so much, when it was time to replace them I ordered these in the same size. The 8s fit so differently. They feel a little narrower and the cushioning doesn't seem as good or as comfortable. These ones don't quite feel a half size smaller, but maybe that's just me, other reviewers are suggesting going up a half size.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Sill

customer_reviews.title: Something changed
customer_reviews.text: I am so dissapointed. I have owned these before and loved them. I am on my feet all day and loved the support. I don't know what changed but the left shoe pinches my heel. Despite trying to tough it out (thinking they just needed broken in) I have had them for 3 months and have only worn them 10 times if that. The sole is firmer in the heel than they used to be leaving me with sore heels. I will have to get something else.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great light stability and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I love the grip and stability. I added arch support insoles as I have very high arches. I’ve logged about 30 miles so far and they’re great!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Postlewait

customer_reviews.title: Great for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had foot pain for over a year because of plantar fasciitis and recurrent cuboid syndrome, and these shoes are amazing! I’ve tried so many different shoes and none have helped at all, many even caused more pain. With these shoes I am able to work out with much less pain, and my foot feels secure and the arch support is great! I’ll definitely be ordering another pair as backup!
customer_reviews.author: 9reedz

customer_reviews.title: OLD LADY LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because my last pair lasted me over 6 years...I would still be wearing the old ones, except on my last vaca my feet were sore after all the walking, and I guessed that maybe they were worn out. The new ones fit like a glove, because I knew my size in this shoe, and they are sooooo supportive, I should have done this long ago! No breaking in what so ever, and so much wonderful support. I am 69 with knee replacement and do a lot of walking type hiking...no running any more, but just a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Buzdor

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and fit
customer_reviews.text: These are the best running shoes I've owned, and this is my third pair of them. I first wear them to the gym, then, after they have experienced some wear, to the trails. The fit is terrific, and the laces stay securely tied (which, I think, has to do with their shape). The tread lasts for the life of the shoe. The toe box is ample, but my big toe eventually wears a hole in the mesh top. That's about the only thing I would suggest in next year's model: a more durable mesh weave on the top of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: RED Sagehen

customer_reviews.title: Love ASICS Gel-Kahana 8 Trail Runner....great support for long runs!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's been a month since I purchased the ASICS Women's Gel-Kahana 8 Trail Runner and have logged over 60 miles. These running shoe's are amazing. Great arch support, roomy toe box, and great traction. I was able to run in the rain and snow with no issues. I highly recommend these running shoes and will definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Torres

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sneakers
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are true to size. I feel like I am walking on air because they are so comfortable. I have back issues and these keep my foot stable and relieve pressure.They are a bit stiff for a true runner, but they're perfect for my cross training and jogging intervals.
customer_reviews.author: Human Library

customer_reviews.title: wore out quickly
customer_reviews.text: Asics quality has gone downhill over the past few years. These shoes broke down pretty quickly,, few months and the support seemed to be worn down (gel?)
customer_reviews.author: A. burton

customer_reviews.title: DREAM RUNNERS
customer_reviews.text: I bought a full size larger than my usual size, as runners often do. At first I wasn't sure if these weren't just a bit too large, but after wearing them for six months now, I can say they were just right. They might be the most comfortable running shoes I've ever had, and I also like to hike in them because they have great traction as well as foot support. The footbed is a DREAM. I will buy another pair. Hope they never go out of stock or style.
customer_reviews.author: teabird

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as my older ASICS
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace an older pair of ASICS that had seen better days. These looked similar enough, but upon wearing for the first work out my left foot became numb. I switched to thinner socks and loosened the laces as much as possible, but my left foot still hurts after wearing these for a long time. The fabric at the top is much rougher than the older shoe, too, and uncomfortable on my ankles (I tried no socks for a few hours, ugh). $70 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Too chuncky
customer_reviews.text: I am a Nike fan but my Husband insisted I should try Asics for a change. I began running again since the Gyms are closed due to the pandemic. It is a great sneaker for trail runs (which is what I needed) and it has great support. Its just a big clunky sneaker. I will keep them for hiking and stuff, but still in the hunt for running sneakers that I like.
customer_reviews.author: MRuiz

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! I run 15-25 miles per week and I need something with a lot of support. I noticed my knees were getting sore with my old shoes, so I decided to try these. I actually initially ordered a different ASCIS running shoe and was unsatisfied with the fit (too narrow, not enough support). These were a little cheaper and had a better description so I tried them and I was pleasantly surprised. Not only are they true to size, they have awesome support and are very nice looking. I really like these shoes and highly suggest them. I've only had them for about a week, but so far they seem to be very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: HoolyBird

customer_reviews.title: True to size, awesome shoe for any activity!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! This is my first pair of ASICS tennis shoes, I’ve always worn Nike or new balance. I’m in love with the fit and the look of these shoes. I have narrow feet and a high arch, the shoes fit like a glove and give great support for everyday wear, walking, running, and even hiking. I’m extremely happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Hrdhm

customer_reviews.title: Risk for falling- not a trail run review
customer_reviews.text: I know this is for trail running. But most of the time i use it at work and I’m almost always falling! Especially if floor is slightly and unnoticeably wet. Maybe an inappropriate review but let me just put it out there.
customer_reviews.author: Jorel Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Where It's Made- Makes a Difference
customer_reviews.text: I love the ASICS when they fit correctly. It took years to figure why some fit and some don't. I wear a 9B to fit comfortable in ASICS. However; they have to be made in Vietnam. If they are made in China or Indonesia then they are too small in length. I tried ordering a 9.5B hoping they would fit but the arch was not in the correct place. The arch felt like it was too far forward and was uncomfortable. This pair confirmed my theory.
customer_reviews.author: The Go To Gal

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been an Asic’s fan for many years, they always fit my feet well. With that being said, when I first tried these on, they were not comfortable at all. They were squeezing around my ankle/ achilles and weren’t comfortable right out of the box like they usually are. I stretched them out with my hands, and then also tried a shoe stretcher because I like the colors and want them to work. They are now a little more comfortable but not great. I’m hoping maybe once they are broken in more, they will fit better.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M

customer_reviews.title: Resistance jog or crosstrainer
customer_reviews.text: I like jogging in these cross trainers because I feel I get more resistance on the road. I seem to feel it more at the end of a jog than with regular jogging lightweight sneakers. I like them; they are durable enough to cross train, hike or jog. Not much give until you wear them a lot which is fine, I have multiple sneakers for different activities.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THEM!! I have never worn Asics before. I was looking for more supportive shoes that were still stylish, and more importantly wouldn't drain my bank account. I absolutely love how these look, fit, feel, and the support they bring to my plantar fasciitis feet. Great purchase and I hope they last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to running shoes but I started doing home workouts and couldn’t do it barefoot any longer. I have short fat feet and my health guru sister suggested these. She recommended I size up, so I did. However they’re still on the tight side. I couldn’t get my foot in at first, then I took the insole out and completely loosened the laces and I could finally squeeze my foot in. I had thin socks on. Anyway after using them a few times, they do the job for my 30 minute work outs and I wear them around the house for a bit before and after. They’re much better than when I first purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy, I use them for walking, running on trails. I am very hard on my sneakers and they hold up. I would say, however that if you are using them for long runs, long walks to put in a gel insole because the insole is very thin and not much cushion for your feet for long hauls. I ordered my normal size and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ralfie

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable. I bought these shoes because I have seen ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. I bought these shoes because I have seen them discussed for plantar fasciitis... they seem to be working very well so far. I've mostly work them with Spenco or Superfeet insoles... but even without insoles, they still provide a good bit of arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy B.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love ASICS and have used them for running for my last few pairs. This series - Gel Kahana - new for me. The are more convertible than my last pair...had to figure out tying my shoe just right so as to address the tightness around center of foot...took a few times to get it just right, but now we are golden.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Harris

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoes. I use them for walking my dogs 3 miles aday and working out anywhere from 80min to two hours. As far arch support I have to use orthopedic in my shoes because I'm so flat footed. But they definitely have good cushion in the heels and good support. I will buy another pair of this when it's to to replace this.
customer_reviews.author: M  Merical

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I jumped right into these shoes and they did not disappoint. I took them out for a 5 mile hike right out of the box! I expected blisters but apart from a little rubbing on the heel they did not hurt at all. And I'd say they were some of the most comfortable shoes I've worn. The gel sole gives a nice cushion and bounce that provides great support over various terrain and lets my feet and legs do the work without excess strain. I was looking for a sold shoe that could handle my active, long walks, runs, hikes and these seem like they up for the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: TINA HOPP

customer_reviews.title: Cradles heal and arch BUT...
customer_reviews.text: When I put these on I thought- wow, this really hugs your heal and arch. Yay! I found my hiking shoes! BUT...as I wore them I realized my foot didn't sit exactly right and therefore they felt increasingly uncomfortable. Return they go. If they hit you perfect, they'd probably be great. If not, they are definately a no go. I'll keep shopping. 🙁
customer_reviews.author: swood

customer_reviews.title: Go to running shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! I was having some knee pain while running - mostly due to wearing shoes that were over 6 years old. I came across the ASICS Gel-kahana 8 while searching amazon for a replacement pair of sneakers. ASICS has always been a reliable and comfortable shoe brand for running and the price on these were reasonable. They are an excellent pair of sneakers. I can really feel the difference with the stability these provide.
customer_reviews.author: baCtalkwisecraK

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Asics for decades. Most running, but also hiking, walking. I have very narrow feet, but use custom orthotics, which take up some space, making the medium width not too loose. This is my third pair of Kahana 8. I still use the first two pair beefed up with some Shoe Goo on the worn areas to run in the rain, so I always have a dry pair ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Order a Half Size Larger
customer_reviews.text: LOVED these sneakers... the look, the style. Unfortunately, I didn't listen to other reviews and ordered my normal size and they were too snug. I would've exchanged them for a half size larger except the size 7s were $18 MORE than the size 6.5. Don't know why the price varies per size, but it was enough to make me not order them. I'll keep watching to see if the size 7s price drops because they are really nice sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: GMB

customer_reviews.title: Fit is Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I really hated these shoes. They have a very weird padding layout, where the front of the foot is heavily padded, but the back is not. That's basically the opposite of what my feet need and made it difficult to run until I broke them in thoroughly. Don't buy these shoes unless you had a chance to try them in-store. They are not "typical" and (I expect) won't fit most people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying Gel-Kahana. Love this shoe for rugged trail running. Fits the same as most Asics I'e bought over the years. Seems to have more arch support than most asics I've used, comfy. I like this color mix in particular as it hides trail dust better than the dark ones I ordered last time. This shoe seems to last longer than some of the other asics trail runners I've had. Good shoe for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Burl Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE!! I’ve owned many hiking and running shoes and these have to be the worst shoe to date. Don’t waste your money! I wish I could send them back! Horrible!!
customer_reviews.author: Tami Tharpe

customer_reviews.title: Very Supportive Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for an upcoming hiking adventure and decided to use them daily to "break them in" - they don't really need the "breaking in" as they fit amazingly and are very supportive and comfortable. I actually like wearing them as my daily walker, too! Very versatile shoe. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Extremely small.
customer_reviews.text: These are super cute, but did not fit at all. I had gone into a store and tried them on and they fit great there, but since amazon had a better price I ordered online. They were so small that I could barely get my toes into the shoe, let alone my entire foot. I was extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: I had to finally replace my old walking trail sneakers. And these sneakers fit just like my old ones but with better support. I thought I was taking a chance ordering sneakers online but it worked out. I normally wear a size 7 with athletic socks and these fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Teri P.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and looks all in one!
customer_reviews.text: I like the width and the round toe area, hard to find shoes that fit rather wide feet. These shoes are comfortable, after a while you forget you have them on. Nice colors, just like on the picture. This is my first ASICS pair, I’m very pleased with the brand. Bought the shoes more for hiking rather than trail running, it was a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm a nurse and on my feet a lot. My last few pair of Asics haven't been that comfortable, and I'm a huge Asics fan. This pair has a lot of support and is extremely comfortable. At the end of my 12 hr shift my feet still feel good. I had to buy another pair. I love them
customer_reviews.author: brandi horner

customer_reviews.title: Feet feel good so far
customer_reviews.text: They feel so good on my feet I have plantar fasciitis & heel spurs on both feet, so I need really good sneakers!
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Finally perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Thank You reviewers: I am a narrow foot 8 1/2 -9 BUT do not wear narrow width shoes: too constricting and the majority of the time make your feet look ridiculously clownish. These Asics are the best: I purchased the 8 1/2 medium and fit like a glove right out of the box. In fact just finished working out home w them. The fit is snug enough and toe box ample room for movement, in additional all you narrow heeled ladies : the heel stays put. Lace the furthest lace opening at lower top : easy to miss this ensures snug secure fit. And I just ordered another pair! thanks Asics
customer_reviews.author: Teton

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfortable and Supportive Shoes for Walking or Running. I love them!
customer_reviews.text: Slipping on a comfortable pair of shoes with an impeccable fit is a little slice of heaven, and these Asics fit the bill. I made the mistake of exploring another brand and even another Asics model before this purchase, but that proved a waste of time because they were uncomfortable and had to be returned, but these tried and true are consistently the BEST! I'll be sticking with 'em forever more; they're my third pair over the last few years and every time no matter which color/style, they feel great on the feet and offer the best support.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: ORDERD ONE SIZE BIGGER THAN STREET SHOES AND STILL TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: THESE SNEAKERS ARE NOT MADE TO STANDARD SIZE MEASUREMENT. I FIND THEY ARE VERY IRREGULAR. I HAVE DECIDED TO BUY IN LOCAL STORES WHERE I CAN TRY THEM ON.
customer_reviews.author: Marj  K

customer_reviews.title: Get a 1/2 size bigger than what you normally wear.
customer_reviews.text: They are very comfortable, they sit up a little higher on my ankle so I must wear different socks. Other than that perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Nana-n-Missouri

customer_reviews.title: Love Asics
customer_reviews.text: Love Asics shoes. I normally wear a 6.5 - 7 I ordered a 6.5 for a tighter fit since I work on my feet all day. I got exactly what I expected. I ended up putting a different insole in the shoe which gave the shoe an even tighter fit. I've worn them every day for a little over a month and they still fit great. The only problem I'm having, which I have with all my shoes, is the rubbing at the heel of the shoe causing a hole on the inside. But I think because I ordered a tighter fit it's helping with the shoe staying in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: OK shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is quite comfortable. The only draw back is the super wide deep treads on the bottom that collect snow, then drop it off inside buildings. With so many people switching to flooring instead of carpeting, wish shoe bottoms would adjust to eliminate collecting rocks, etc. that only harm flooring. There are some with smoother, yet grip-like soles.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great show! Bought for my daughter who has overpronation bad. Her podiatrist advised to get these or Brooks. Brooks are highly expensive and until she is done growing, I needed something more affordable. She also wears inserts, which does very well in these!
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof3

customer_reviews.title: Fits my weird feet perfectly without adding a fancy insole
customer_reviews.text: Finally...an athletic shoe that perfectly fits my foot. It was a little off when I first put it on but it soon conformed to my foot. I have to make sure my foot is seated correctly into the shoe and the laces are tied just right (not too tight or loose). I can see how other people might hate them, but I have terrible arches and these cradled them perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: V. Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I have a problem with bunions and a very tender ball of the foot. I needed something that would be easy on the bunion and have lots of padding. At first the shoes didn't take care of the problem because there wasn't enough padding in the shoe. I took their insoles out and put some store bought inserts in. They work much better for me now. I am learning that the shoe is a little rigid and made for pronation but they are working well for me now.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a hospital, & are on my feet all day. I had my last pair for about 6 months before they started messing up. No shoes are really built to last especially if you wear them everyday for 8 to 16 hours a day. These shoes are not build to last, but they’re GREAT shoes as long as they last! I give them a 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger York

customer_reviews.title: They run a little big
customer_reviews.text: It might be my fault because I normally wear an 8.5 but lately when I buy shoes online they have always been too small. So I ordered half size to big and well they are. I mean I can still wear them, they fit but I feel like they are too big.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Kish

customer_reviews.title: ASICS!
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes for running or walking! The insoles are hard so I got some memory foam insoles and changed them and now they are nearly perfect in my opinion. I do have to say I think these run a bit large but overall nice to wear and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inflexible
customer_reviews.text: these shoes are hard and not very flexible. I wore them once and threw out the box so unfortunately cannot return them. They'll sit in my closet now, unworn and useless.
customer_reviews.author: GSD owner

customer_reviews.title: Would not recomment
customer_reviews.text: The rubber bottom came loose after less than 2 month. Contacted the seller but can't seem to get a response
customer_reviews.author: Pegasus17

customer_reviews.title: Good support.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the arch support. I disliked it picking my toes. I used it for trail running 5k.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great, they fit as as expected and had enough room for me to put in my orthotics. The only thing that I had a problem with is when you walk on a smooth floor like vinyl they slip. I felt like I was walking on ice. I think this will get better as I wear them more. They are great outside especially on rough terrain.
customer_reviews.author: dopey

customer_reviews.title: Predictable fit, good stability
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Asics for more than 10 years. Their sizing is consistent and always fit as expected. I bought these for tails and really appreciate the lateral stability for uneven terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen R.

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrated uppers
customer_reviews.text: The shoe itself is very attractive, very comfortable and seemingly well made except... Unfortunately, within 6 months of only wearing them a couple times a week for walking in the park, the mesh uppers started to disintegrate before the shoe really had much wear. A total deal breaker in an otherwise great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: HardPressedLMT

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable and great support shoe! WONDERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes! The are not the pointy, no room for your toes shoes. They fit great in the heel, extremely cushy and so comfortable across the the top of the shoe. Also, wonderful arch support! If there is one complaint....the shoe laces come untied. Simple and cheap fix...buy new laces. Highly recommend these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great support and comfortable from the first wearing.
customer_reviews.text: Great value, solid construction toe area roomy, slightly narrow right before toes but I just use a lightweight sock or barefoot. My feet are a regular width and if anything a bit thin up and down. The first knuckle on my big toe is touchy if the shoe runs narrow so it is close, but thin socks keep it feeling fine. Support is perfect for our 12 mile beach hikes including walking the Rocky points along the ocean.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: HAZARD
customer_reviews.text: I typically only wear ASICS and these particular ones are so slippery on the bottom of both sneakers. I had a near fall twice before and forgot how slippery they were and fell straight down on my wrist today. And it has nothing to do with being clumsy. You can literally slip on anything with these. Mopped floor, rain on the sidewalk, wet trails, etc. I will not be wearing these again because they are definitely a hazard and will be in touch with the seller and manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Richa

customer_reviews.title: Good trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: Wore Asics street shoes years ago then switched to Mizuno trail because Asics didnt make trail shoes at the time. Glad to be back in Asics. As with any running shoe, size up a 1/2 size (at least) . Good grip and toe protection. I run about 10 miles a week so if you do more than that, don't know how they will hold up for you.
customer_reviews.author: LeslieD13

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife, happy life
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves the overall support of this model. She says it’s like walking on a cloud. I’ve been a very happy ASICS customer for years, and this is the wife’s first pair. She says they’re the most comfortable shoes she’s ever had. Two thumbs up & 5 stars for this model.
customer_reviews.author: Moonshine Hazard

product_meta.title: ASICS Women's Gel-Kahana 8 Trail Runner
product_meta.description:
Known for durability, stability, and its rugged style, the gel-kahana 8 shoe offers our gel cushioning system for comfort and performance where the rubber meets the road or trail.

In 1949, Mr. Kihachiro Onitsuka began his athletic footwear company (Onitsuka Co., Ltd.) by manufacturing basketball shoes out of his living room in Kobe, Japan. He chose the name ASICS for his company in 1977, based on a famous Latin phrase "Anima Sana In Corpore Sano," which, when translated, expresses the ancient ideal of "A Sound Mind in a Sound Body." Taking the acronym of this phrase, ASICS was founded on the belief that the best way to create a healthy and happy lifestyle is to promote total health and fitness. Today, ASICS offers a full line of performance-driven athletic shoes and technical active sports apparel and accessories dedicated to bringing harmony to the body and soul.
feature_bullets: Rearfoot GEL Cushioning System: Attenuates shock during impact phase and allows for a smooth transition to midstance.
SpEVA Midsole: Material Improves bounce-back characteristics and decreases midsole breakdown.
DuoMax Support System: A dual-density midsole system positioned to enhance support and stability.
Trusstic System: Reduces the weight of the sole unit while retaining the structural integrity of the shoe.
Trail Specific Outsole: Reversed lugs provide uphill and downhill traction on all types of terrain.
